measure.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to find the size, length, or amount of something, using standard units such as inches, metres etc
measure.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The rainfall was measured over a three-month period.
She was being measured for her wedding dress.
We can measure the energy that food provides in calories.
measure.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to judge the importance, value, or true nature of something
measure.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Doctors say it is too early to measure the effectiveness of the drug.
Education shouldn’t be measured purely by examination results.
measure.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to be a particular size, length, or amount
measure.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The earthquake measured 6.5 on the Richter scale.
measure.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if a piece of equipment measures something, it shows or records a particular kind of measurement
measure.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: An odometer measures the number of miles your car travels.
measure.translation[1].definitions[0].de: an action, especially an official one, that is intended to deal with a particular problem
measure.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Measures are being taken to reduce crime in the city.
New safety measures were being demanded after last night’s horrific train crash.
The new bridge was erected as a temporary measure to replace the one which was destroyed by floods.
drastic measures to reduce traffic problems
He was kept in hospital overnight as a precautionary measure.
measure.translation[1].definitions[1].de: an amount or unit in a measuring system
measure.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: a table of weights and measures
measure.translation[1].definitions[2].de: a standard amount of an alcoholic drink
measure.translation[1].definitions[3].de: something used for measuring, for example a piece of wood or a container
measure.translation[1].definitions[4].de: a group of notes and rests, separated from other groups by vertical lines, into which a piece of music is divided
measure.translation[1].note_box[0].secti: take measures
We are taking measures to improve the situation.
adopt/introduce a measure
The countries agreed to adopt measures to reduce pollution.
a measure is aimed at doing something
The measures were aimed at reducing the speed of cars on the roads.
ADJECTIVES/NOUN + measure
a safety measure
New safety measures were implemented after the rail crash.
a security measure
Video surveillance cameras have been installed as a security measure.
a preventative/precautionary measure
Vaccination against disease is a sensible preventative measure.
a extreme measure
The public would not be in favour of such an extreme measure.
a drastic measure
Drastic measures are needed if we are to combat global warming.
a temporary measure
The tents were used as a temporary measure to replace homes destroyed in the floods.
a necessary measure
The army will take all necessary measures to protect the public.
an appropriate measure
In the event of an assault, staff will need to take appropriate measures to defend themselves.
a package/series of measures
A package of road safety measures has been announced.
measure.translation[2].definitions[0].de: an official action, taken to deal with a particular problem
measure.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: The company has had to take cost-cutting measures, including reducing spending on certain marketing programs.
measure.translation[2].definitions[1].de: a way of measuring or calculating something
measure.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: Gross domestic product is the Commerce Department’s main measure of U.S. economic output.
Car sales are often seen as a measure of consumer confidence.

measure.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: a table of weights and measures
measure.translation[3].definitions[0].de: to find out or calculate the amount or level of something
measure.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: ways to measure and improve service quality
This country has the third highest standard of living, as measured by per capita GDP.
All currencies have historically been measured against gold.
